instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message:
boards looks clean.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 1-2v both side
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> = 0v

what i need to do from here, i've never work on this model.
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area looks fresh.

every few minutes the MagSafe will flash green light and fan move a little for a spit second.

ISL =
7/18 = 3.1 omhs
27/18 = 20 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message: mmm, it post using battery power, i can hear keyboard sound. but no images nor backlight. can charge battery with orange light but no green light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message: 3V42 missing on AC is the first thing to fix. Probably an issue around <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> or <DIODE>D7010</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message:
now has green light,orange light, fan spin with a magsafe. need to fix no video.

12.57v on both side of lcd fuse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message: Try a known good LCD, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high? Inspect connector/cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message:
nothing showing up on external monitor via hdmi and displayport. 

can i test with a 13" 2014 lcd?

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is low - 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> should be high, at 0 voIt, SMC thinks the lid is closed so no backlight pwm resulting in no backlight boosting.
Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal is not shorted to ground, pulled down by an open resistor or bad trace.
Also water may have corroded the hall sensor J5250.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message: sorry i got it wrong. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is at 3.429v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C9327</CAPACITOR>'s pin1 is burnt
<CAPACITOR>C9323</CAPACITOR>'s pin1 is dark
<RESISTOR>R9115</RESISTOR>'s pin1 is slightly burnt but still 34.8K

dead gnu?


<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX</SIGNAL> is gpu vcore right? 0.858v
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message:
i've replaced  <CAPACITOR>C9327</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9323</CAPACITOR>

now i get video and backlight.

why this two matter?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message: They don't unless they were shorted. Something else heated up and made it work again. Expect issue to return.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged - no power.
threads.message: i used hot tweezer only. hopefully, they were shorted. i'll give it a test. i'll let you know if occur...
